Melchisedec.note: King of Salem and priest of God Most High, a type of Christ (Genesis 14:18; Hebrews 7:1–3).

Messiah.note: Means 'Anointed One,' a prophetic title fulfilled in Jesus (John 1:41).

Potentate.note: A title for Christ as the supreme ruler, used in a hymn of praise (1 Timothy 6:15).

Alpha and Omega.note: A title for Jesus declaring Him as the beginning and the end (Revelation 22:13).

Branch.note: A prophetic title for the Messiah as a shoot from David’s line (Zechariah 3:8; Isaiah 11:1).

Emmanuel.note: Means 'God with us,' a prophetic name for Jesus (Isaiah 7:14; Matthew 1:23).

King of kings.note: A title of supreme authority given to Christ as ruler over all (Revelation 19:16).

Lamb of God.note: A title pointing to Jesus as the sacrificial offering for sin (John 1:29).

Prince of Peace.note: A title in Isaiah’s prophecy describing the Messiah’s rule of lasting peace (Isaiah 9:6).

Rock.note: Symbolic of Christ as a firm foundation and source of spiritual strength (1 Corinthians 10:4).

Son of David.note: A messianic title affirming Jesus' royal descent from David (Matthew 1:1; 21:9).

Son of God.note: A divine title for Jesus affirming His unique relationship with the Father (Mark 1:1; John 20:31).

Jehovah-jireh.note: Title meaning 'The Lord will provide,' expressing God's providential care.

Jehovah Nissi.note: Title meaning 'The Lord is my banner,' signifying God as a protector and rallying point.

Jehovah Raah.note: Title meaning 'The Lord is my Shepherd,' emphasizing guidance and care.

Jehovah Rapha.note: Title meaning 'The Lord who heals,' emphasizing God's power to heal physically and spiritually.

Jehovah Sabaoth.note: Title meaning 'The Lord of Hosts,' emphasizing God’s leadership of heavenly armies.

Jehovah Shalom.note: Title meaning 'The Lord is Peace,' indicating God's ability to bring peace and wholeness.

Jehovah Shammah.note: Title meaning 'The Lord is there,' highlighting God's ever-present nature.

Jehovah Tsidkenu.note: Title meaning 'The Lord our righteousness,' emphasizing God as the source of righteousness.
